member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AC_SRC_OVER
member.summary: currentlly defined blend function

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AC_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: alpha format flags

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_HOR_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from left to right. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with AW_CENTER or AW_BLEND.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_HOR_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from right to left. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with AW_CENTER or AW_BLEND.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_VER_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from top to bottom. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with AW_CENTER or AW_BLEND.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_VER_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from bottom to top. This flag can be use

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_CENTER
member.summary: Makes the window appear to collapse inward if AW_HIDE is used or expand outward if the AW_HIDE is not used. The various direction flags have no effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window. By default, the window is shown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates the window. Do not use this value with AW_HIDE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_SLIDE
member.summary: Uses slide animation. By default, roll animation is used. This flag is ignored when used with AW_CENTER.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.AW_BLEND
member.summary: Uses a fade effect. This flag can be used only if hwnd is a top-level window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Background remains untouched.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.OPAQUE
member.summary: Background is filled with the current background color before the text, hatched brush, or pen is drawn.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.BKMODE_LAST
member.summary: 无效,值与OPAQUE相同

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CCHILDREN_TITLEBAR
member.summary: TITLEBARINFO::rgstate 的最大索引

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CCHILDREN_SCROLLBAR
member.summary: SCROLLBARINFO::rgstate 的最大索引

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_VREDRAW
member.summary: 如果移动或大小调整改变客户区的高度，将重新绘制整个窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_HREDRAW
member.summary: 如果移动或大小调整更改客户端区域的宽度将重新绘制整个窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_DBLCLKS
member.summary: 双击消息发送到窗口过程，当用户双击鼠标，当光标位于窗口属于类内。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_OWNDC
member.summary: 为每个窗口类中分配一个唯一的设备上下文。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_CLASSDC
member.summary: 分配一个设备上下文的所有 windows 共享的类中。因为窗口类是特定的进程，有可能为多个线程的应用程序创建一个窗口在同一类。它也是可能的线程尝试同时使用的设备上下文。当发生这种情况时，系统只允许一个线程以成功地完成它的绘制操作。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_PARENTDC
member.summary: 设置剪辑矩形的子窗口的父窗口以便儿童可以绘制在父。一个带有 CS_PARENTDC 样式位窗口接收常规设备上下文的从设备上下文中的系统的缓存。它不给孩子父母的设备上下文或设备上下文设置。指定 CS_PARENTDC 增强了应用程序的性能。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_NOCLOSE
member.summary: 在窗口菜单中禁用关闭。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_SAVEBITS
member.summary: 作为一个位图保存此类的窗口被遮盖的屏幕图像的部分。窗口中删除时，系统将使用已保存的位图要还原的屏幕图像，包括其他被遮盖的窗口。因此，系统并不发送 WM_PAINT 消息到被遮盖如果位图所使用的内存不被丢弃，如果其他屏幕操作有不失效的存储的图像的 windows。这种样式很有用的小窗口 （例如，菜单或对话框），简要地显示，然后删除其他屏幕活动发生之前。这种风格会增加因为系统必须首先分配的内存来存储该位图显示窗口所需的时间。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_BYTEALIGNCLIENT
member.summary: 将窗口的客户端区域 （在 x 方向） 的字节边界上对齐。这种风格影响窗口，显示其水平放置的宽度。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_BYTEALIGNWINDOW
member.summary: 将窗口 （在 x 方向） 的字节边界上对齐。这种风格影响窗口，显示其水平放置的宽度。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_GLOBALCLASS
member.summary: 指示窗口类是一个应用程序的全局类。更多的信息，请参阅关于窗口类的"应用程序全局类"一节。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_IME
member.summary: 指示窗口类是输入法的UI类

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CS_DROPSHADOW
member.summary: 使窗口上的投影效果。通过 SPI_SETDROPSHADOW，效果被打开和关闭。通常情况下，这是为启用小，寿命较短的窗口，例如菜单强调他们与其他窗口的 Z-顺序关系。从使用此样式类创建的窗口必须是顶级窗口 ；他们可能不是子窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CW_USEDEFAULT
member.summary: CreateWindow x,y,nWidth,nHeight 默认值

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_WINDOW
member.summary: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_CACHE
member.summary: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_NORESETATTRS
member.summary: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_PARENTCLIP
member.summary: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_EXCLUDERGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_INTERSECTRGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE
member.summary: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DCX_VALIDATE
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DriverStringOptionsCmapLookup
member.summary: Specifies that the string array contains Unicode character values. If this flag is not set, each value in array is interpreted as an index to a font glyph that defines a character to be displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DriverStringOptionsVertical
member.summary: Specifies that the string is displayed vertically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DriverStringOptionsAdvance
member.summary: Specifies that the glyph positions are calculated from the position of the first glyph. If this flag is not set, the glyph positions are obtained from an array of coordinates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DriverStringOptionsLimitSubpixel
member.summary: Specifies that less memory should be used for cache of antialiased glyphs. This also produces lower quality. If this flag is set, more memory is used, but the quality is higher.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_ABSALIGN
member.summary: Indicates that the coordinates of the dialog box are screen coordinates. If this style is not specified, the coordinates are client coordinates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_SYSMODAL
member.summary: This style is obsolete and is included for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows. If you specify this style, the system creates the dialog box with the WS_EX_TOPMOST style. This style does not prevent the user from accessing other windows on the desktop.Do not combine this style with the DS_CONTROL style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_LOCALEDIT
member.summary: Applies to 16-bit applications only. This style directs edit controls in the dialog box to allocate memory from the application's data segment. Otherwise, edit controls allocate storage from a global memory object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_SETFONT
member.summary: Indicates that the header of the dialog box template (either standard or extended) contains additional data specifying the font to use for text in the client area and controls of the dialog box. If possible, the system selects a font according to the specified font data. The system passes a handle to the font to the dialog box and to each control by sending them the WM_SETFONT message. For descriptions of the format of this font data, see DLGTEMPLATE and DLGTEMPLATEEX.If neither DS_SETFONT nor DS_SHELLFONT is specified, the dialog box template does not include the font data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_MODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a dialog box with a modal dialog-box frame that can be combined with a title bar and window menu by specifying the WS_CAPTION and WS_SYSMENU styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_NOIDLEMSG
member.summary: Suppresses WM_ENTERIDLE messages that the system would otherwise send to the owner of the dialog box while the dialog box is displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_SETFOREGROUND
member.summary: Causes the system to use the SetForegroundWindow function to bring the dialog box to the foreground. This style is useful for modal dialog boxes that require immediate attention from the user regardless of whether the owner window is the foreground window.The system restricts which processes can set the foreground window. For more information, see Foreground and Background Windows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_3DLOOK
member.summary: Obsolete. The system automatically applies the three-dimensional look to dialog boxes created by applications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_FIXEDSYS
member.summary: Causes the dialog box to use the SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT instead of the default SYSTEM_FONT. This is a monospace font compatible with the System font in 16-bit versions of Windows earlier than 3.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_NOFAILCREATE
member.summary: Creates the dialog box even if errors occur — for example, if a child window cannot be created or if the system cannot create a special data segment for an edit control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_CONTROL
member.summary: Creates a dialog box that works well as a child window of another dialog box, much like a page in a property sheet. This style allows the user to tab among the control windows of a child dialog box, use its accelerator keys, and so on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_CENTER
member.summary: Centers the dialog box in the working area of the monitor that contains the owner window. If no owner window is specified, the dialog box is centered in the working area of a monitor determined by the system. The working area is the area not obscured by the taskbar or any appbars.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_CENTERMOUSE
member.summary: Centers the dialog box on the mouse cursor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the dialog box. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message. The control should pass the message to the dialog box procedure, which should call the function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the control.Note that DS_CONTEXTHELP is only a placeholder. When the dialog box is created, the system checks for DS_CONTEXTHELP and, if it is there, adds WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP to the extended style of the dialog box. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_SHELLFONT
member.summary: Indicates that the dialog box should use the system font. The typeface member of the extended dialog box template must be set to MS Shell Dlg. Otherwise, this style has no effect. It is also recommended that you use the DIALOGEX Resource, rather than the DIALOG Resource. For more information, see Dialog Box Fonts.The system selects a font using the font data specified in the pointsize, weight, and italic members. The system passes a handle to the font to the dialog box and to each control by sending them the WM_SETFONT message. For descriptions of the format of this font data, see DLGTEMPLATEEX.If neither DS_SHELLFONT nor DS_SETFONT is specified, the extended dialog box template does not include the font data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DS_USEPIXELS
member.summary: no note

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_STOP
member.summary: Stop flashing. The system restores the window to its original state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_CAPTION
member.summary: Flash the window caption.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_TRAY
member.summary: Flash the taskbar button.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_ALL
member.summary: Flash both the window caption and taskbar button. This is equivalent to setting the FLASHW_CAPTION | FLASHW_TRAY flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_TIMER
member.summary: Flash continuously, until the FLASHW_STOP flag is set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FLASHW_TIMERNOFG
member.summary: Flash continuously until the window comes to the foreground.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER
member.summary: 函数会分配一个足够大的缓冲区保存格式化消息，并且通过lpBuffer指向该地址。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS
member.summary: 消息定义中的插入序列会被一直忽略和跳过直到输出缓冲区不改变，并且Arguments会被忽略。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_STRING
member.summary: lpSource参数是一个指向以NULL结尾的字符串，字符串包含一个消息定义，这个消息定义可以包含插入序列。此标志最好不要和FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_HMODULE或者FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM使用

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_HMODULE
member.summary: lpSource参数是需要去搜索的一个包含消息表的模块线程。如果lpSource是NULL，当前进程的应用图像会被搜索，这个标志不能同FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_STRING使用。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM
member.summary: 函数会为了请求的信息而搜索系统的消息表资源。如果标志同时也指定了FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_HMODULE，那么函数会先在lpSource指定的模块中搜索请求的消息，如果搜索不到，就去搜索系统消息表资源。此标志不能与FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_STRING使用。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_ARGUMENT_ARRAY
member.summary: Arguments参数不是指向va_list结构体，但是是一个指向保存参数的数据。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.FORMAT_MESSAGE_MAX_WIDTH_MASK
member.summary: 掩码

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GA_PARENT
member.summary: Retrieves the parent window. This does not include the owner, as it does with the GetParent function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GA_ROOT
member.summary: Retrieves the root window by walking the chain of parent windows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GA_ROOTOWNER
member.summary: Retrieves the owned root window by walking the chain of parent and owner windows returned by GetParent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_MENUNAME
member.summary: 获取或设置菜单名字符串的地址。该字符串标识与类有关的菜单资源。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_HBRBACKGROUND
member.summary: 获取或设置与类有关的背景刷子的句柄。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_HCURSOR
member.summary: 获取或设置与类有关的光标的句柄。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_HICON
member.summary: 获取或设置与类有关的图标的句柄。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_HMODULE
member.summary: 获取或设置注册类的模块的句柄。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_CBWNDEXTRA
member.summary: 获取或设置与类中的每一个窗口相关的尺寸的字节大小。设定该值不改变已分配额外字节数。查看如何进入该内存，参看SetWindowLOng。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_CBCLSEXTRA
member.summary: 获取或设置与类相关的尺寸的字节大小。设定该值不改变己分配的额外字节数。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_WNDPROC
member.summary: 获取或设置与窗口类有关的窗口过程的地址。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_STYLE
member.summary: 获取或设置窗口类的风格位。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCW_ATOM
member.summary: 获取或设置一个 ATOM值唯一标识窗口类。这是在相同的原子RegisterClassEx函数返回。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GCL_HICONSM
member.summary: 获取或设置一个句柄与类关联的小图标。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GRADIENT_FILL_RECT_H
member.summary: 在该模式下，两个端点表示一个矩形。该矩形被定义成左右边界具有固定颜色（由TRIVERTEX结构指定）。GDI从上至下插入颜色，并填充内部区域。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GRADIENT_FILL_RECT_V
member.summary: 在该模式下，两个端点表示一个矩形。该矩形定义其顶部和底部边界的颜色为固定值（通过TRIVERTEX结构指定），GDI从顶至底部边界插入颜色，并填充内部区域。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GRADIENT_FILL_TRIANGLE
member.summary: 在该模式下，TRIVERTEX结构数组以及描述单个三角形的数组索引序列被传给GDI。GDI在三角形顶点之间进行线性插值，并填充内部区域。在24和32位/像素模式下，绘图是直接进行。在16、8、4和1位/像素模式中进行抖动处理。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GRADIENT_FILL_OP_FLAG
member.summary: 该值无效

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_HWNDFIRST
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is highest in the Z order.If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies a topmost window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies a top-level window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies a sibling window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_HWNDLAST
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is lowest in the Z order.If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies a topmost window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies a top-level window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies a sibling window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_HWNDNEXT
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window below the specified window in the Z order.If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies a topmost window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies a top-level window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies a sibling window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_HWNDPREV
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window above the specified window in the Z order.If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies a topmost window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies a top-level window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies a sibling window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_OWNER
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the specified window's owner window, if any. For more information, see Owned Windows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_CHILD
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the child window at the top of the Z order, if the specified window is a parent window; otherwise, the retrieved handle is NULL. The function examines only child windows of the specified window. It does not examine descendant windows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GW_ENABLEDPOPUP
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the enabled popup window owned by the specified window (the search uses the first such window found using GW_HWNDNEXT); otherwise, if there are no enabled popup windows, the retrieved handle is that of the specified window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GWL_USERDATA
member.summary: Retrieves the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GWL_EXSTYLE
member.summary: Retrieves the extended window styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.GWL_STYLE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.KLF_UNLOADPREVIOUS
member.summary: This flag is unsupported. Use the UnloadKeyboardLayout function instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.KLF_REORDER
member.summary: If this bit is set, the system's circular list of loaded locale identifiers is reordered by moving the locale identifier to the head of the list. If this bit is not set, the list is rotated without a change of order.For example, if a user had an English locale identifier active, as well as having French, German, and Spanish locale identifiers loaded (in that order), then activating the German locale identifier with the KLF_REORDER bit set would produce the following order: German, English, French, Spanish. Activating the German locale identifier without the KLF_REORDER bit set would produce the following order: German, Spanish, English, French.If less than three locale identifiers are loaded, the value of this flag is irrelevant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.KLF_SETFORPROCESS
member.summary: Activates the specified locale identifier for the entire process and sends the WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE message to the current thread's focus or active window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.KLF_SHIFTLOCK
member.summary: This is used with KLF_RESET. See KLF_RESET for an explanation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.KLF_RESET
member.summary: If set but KLF_SHIFTLOCK is not set, the Caps Lock state is turned off by pressing the Caps Lock key again. If set and KLF_SHIFTLOCK is also set, the Caps Lock state is turned off by pressing either SHIFT key.These two methods are mutually exclusive, and the setting persists as part of the User's profile in the registry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.MOUSEEVENTF_ABSOLUTE
member.summary: The dx and dy members contain normalized absolute coordinates. If the flag is not set, dxand dy contain relative data (the change in position since the last reported position). This flag can be set, or not set, regardless of what kind of mouse or other pointing device, if any, is connected to the system. For further information about relative mouse motion, see the following Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.RGN_MAX

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SRCERASE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.MERGECOPY

member.summary: 通过使用布尔型的OR（或）操作符将反向的源矩形区域的颜色与目标矩形区域的颜色合并。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.PATCOPY

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.PATPAINT
member.summary: 通过使用布尔OR（或）操作符将源矩形区域取反后的颜色值与特定模式的颜色合并。然后使用OR（或）操作符将该操作的结果与目标矩形区域内的颜色合并。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.PATINVERT
member.summary: 通过使用XOR（异或）操作符将源和目标矩形区域内的颜色合并。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.DSTINVERT

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.BLACKNESS

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.WHITENESS
member.summary: 使用与物理调色板中索引1有关的颜色填充目标矩形区域。（对于缺省物理调色板来说，这个颜色就是白色）。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SB_ENDSCROLL
member.summary: Ends scroll.

summary.para: The SBM_SETPOS message is sent to set the position of the scroll box (thumb) and, if requested, redraw the scroll bar to reflect the new position of the scroll box.
Applications should not send this message directly.
Instead, they should use the SetScrollPos function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the SetScrollPos function to work properly.
The SBM_GETPOS message is sent to retrieve the current position of the scroll box of a scroll bar control.
The current position is a relative value that depends on the current scrolling range.
For example, if the scrolling range is 0 through 100 and the scroll box is in the middle of the bar, the current position is 50.
Applications should not send this message directly. Instead, they should use the GetScrollPos function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the GetScrollPos function to function properly.
The SBM_SETRANGE message is sent to set the minimum and maximum position values for the scroll bar control.
Applications should not send this message directly.
Instead, they should use the SetScrollRange function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the SetScrollRange function to work properly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SBM_SETRANGEREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the SBM_SETRANGEREDRAW message to a scroll bar control to set the minimum and maximum position values and to redraw the control.to work properly.

summary.para: The SBM_GETRANGE message is sent to retrieve the minimum and maximum position values for the scroll bar control.
Applications should not send this message directly. Instead, they should use the GetScrollRange function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the GetScrollRange function to work properly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SBM_ENABLE_ARROWS
member.summary: An application sends the SBM_ENABLE_ARROWS message to enable or disable one or both arrows of a scroll bar control.

summary.para: The SBM_SETSCROLLINFO message is sent to set the parameters of a scroll bar.
Applications should not send this message directly.
Instead, they should use the SetScrollInfo function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the SetScrollInfo function to function properly.
The SBM_GETSCROLLINFO message is sent to retrieve the parameters of a scroll bar.
Applications should not send this message directly. Instead, they should use the GetScrollInfo function.
A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
Applications which implement a custom scroll bar control must respond to these messages for the GetScrollInfo function to work properly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SBM_GETSCROLLBARINFO
member.summary: Sent by an application to retrieve information about the specified scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_MONITORPOWER
member.summary: Sets the state of the display. This command supports devices that have power-saving features, such as a battery-powered personal computer. The lParam parameter can have the following values: -1 = the display is powering on,1 = the display is going to low power, 2 = the display is being shut off

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_SEPARATOR
member.summary: TODO

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SCF_ISSECURE
member.summary: Indicates whether the screen saver is secure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_ICON
member.summary: Obsolete names

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SC_ZOOM
member.summary: Obsolete names

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.ERROR
member.summary: 发生错误（以前的剪切区域不受影响）

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.NULLREGION
member.summary: 区域为空

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIMPLEREGION
member.summary: 区域为单个矩形

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.COMPLEXREGION
member.summary: 区域为多个矩形

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.RGN_ERROR
member.summary: 发生错误（以前的剪切区域不受影响）

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_RANGE
member.summary: The nMin and nMax members contain the minimum and maximum values for the scrolling range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_PAGE
member.summary: The nPage member contains the page size for a proportional scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_POS
member.summary: The nPos member contains the scroll box position, which is not updated while the user drags the scroll box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL
member.summary: This value is used only when setting a scroll bar's parameters. If the scroll bar's new parameters make the scroll bar unnecessary, disable the scroll bar instead of removing it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_TRACKPOS
member.summary: The nTrackPos member contains the current position of the scroll box while the user is dragging it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SIF_ALL
member.summary: Combination of SIF_PAGE, SIF_POS, SIF_RANGE, and SIF_TRACKPOS.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, HORZRES).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, VERTRES).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXVSCROLL
member.summary: The width of a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYHSCROLL
member.summary: The height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a caption area, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXBORDER
member.summary: The width of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CXEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYBORDER
member.summary: The height of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CYEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border.This value is the same as SM_CXDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border.This value is the same as SM_CYDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYVTHUMB
member.summary: The height of the thumb box in a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXHTHUMB
member.summary: The width of the thumb box in a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXICON
member.summary: The default width of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions that SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON specifies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYICON
member.summary: The default height of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXCURSOR
member.summary: The width of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYCURSOR
member.summary: The height of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMENU
member.summary: The height of a single-line menu bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen that is not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfo function with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfo function with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYKANJIWINDOW
member.summary: For double byte character set versions of the system, this is the height of the Kanji window at the bottom of the screen, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MOUSEPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; otherwise, 0. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYVSCROLL
member.summary: The height of the arrow bitmap on a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXHSCROLL
member.summary: The width of the arrow bitmap on a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_DEBUG
member.summary: Nonzero if the debug version of User.exe is installed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SWAPBUTTON
member.summary: Nonzero if the meanings of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMIN
member.summary: The minimum width of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMIN
member.summary: The minimum height of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXSIZE
member.summary: The width of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSIZE
member.summary: The height of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border.This value is the same as SM_CXFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border.This value is the same as SM_CYFRAME.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking height of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The width of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle that is defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time.To set the width of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKWIDTH.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The height of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time.To set the height of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKHEIGHT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXICONSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXICON.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYICONSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MENUDROPALIGNMENT
member.summary: Nonzero if drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu-bar item; 0 if the menus are left-aligned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_PENWINDOWS
member.summary: Nonzero if the Microsoft Windows for Pen computing extensions are installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_DBCSENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CMOUSEBUTTONS
member.summary: The number of buttons on a mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SECURE
member.summary: This system metric should be ignored; it always returns 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXEDGE
member.summary: The width of a 3-D border, in pixels. This metric is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CXBORDER.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYEDGE
member.summary: The height of a 3-D border, in pixels. This is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CYBORDER.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMINSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMINSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXSMICON
member.summary: The recommended width of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSMICON
member.summary: The recommended height of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSMCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a small caption, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXSMSIZE
member.summary: The width of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYSMSIZE
member.summary: The height of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMENUSIZE
member.summary: The width of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMENUSIZE
member.summary: The height of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_ARRANGE
member.summary: The flags that specify how the system arranged minimized windows. For more information, see the Remarks section in this topic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMINIMIZED
member.summary: The width of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMINIMIZED
member.summary: The height of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum width of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum height of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default width, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_NETWORK
member.summary: The least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CLEANBOOT
member.summary: The value that specifies how the system is started:0 Normal boot1 Fail-safe boot2 Fail-safe with network bootA fail-safe boot (also called SafeBoot, Safe Mode, or Clean Boot) bypasses the user startup files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels on either side of a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from the left of the mouse-down point and added to the right of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels above and below a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from above the mouse-down point and added below it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SHOWSOUNDS
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXMENUCHECK
member.summary: The width of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYMENUCHECK
member.summary: The height of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SLOWMACHINE
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MIDEASTENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, 0 if not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MOUSEWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a vertical scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the width of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the top of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the height of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the top of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CMONITORS
member.summary: The number of display monitors on a desktop. For more information, see the Remarks section in this topic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
member.summary: Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, otherwise, 0. Two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats. For example, the red, green, and blue pixels can be encoded with different numbers of bits, or those bits can be located in different places in a pixel color value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_IMMENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; otherwise, 0.SM_IMMENABLED indicates whether the system is ready to use a Unicode-based IME on a Unicode application. To ensure that a language-dependent IME works, check SM_DBCSENABLED and the system ANSI code page. Otherwise the ANSI-to-Unicode conversion may not be performed correctly, or some components like fonts or registry settings may not be present.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle that the DrawFocusRect draws. This value is in pixels.Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CYFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The height of the top and bottom edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition or if the current operating system is Windows Vista or Windows 7 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The SM_DIGITIZER setting indicates the type of digitizer input supported by a device running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, 0 if not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_STARTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 Starter Edition, Windows Vista Starter, or Windows XP Starter Edition; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SERVERR2
member.summary: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MOUSEHORIZONTALWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a horizontal scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CXPADDEDBORDER
member.summary: The amount of border padding for captioned windows, in pixels.Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_DIGITIZER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The return value is a bitmask that specifies the type of digitizer input supported by the device. For more information, see Remarks.Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES
member.summary: Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0.SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES returns the aggregate maximum of the maximum number of contacts supported by every digitizer in the system. If the system has only single-touch digitizers, the return value is 1. If the system has multi-touch digitizers, the return value is the number of simultaneous contacts the hardware can provide.Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Services console session, the return value is 0.Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: The console session is not necessarily the physical console. For more information, see WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SHUTTINGDOWN
member.summary: Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; otherwise, 0.Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_REMOTECONTROL
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment to determine if the current Terminal Server session is being remotely controlled. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; otherwise, 0.You can use terminal services management tools such as Terminal Services Manager (tsadmin.msc) and shadow.exe to control a remote session. When a session is being remotely controlled, another user can view the contents of that session and potentially interact with it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_CONVERTIBLESLATEMODE
member.summary: Reflects the state of the laptop or slate mode, 0 for Slate Mode and non-zero otherwise. When this system metric changes, the system sends a broadcast message via WM_SETTINGCHANGE with "ConvertibleSlateMode" in the LPARAM.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SM_SYSTEMDOCKED
member.summary: Reflects the state of the docking mode, 0 for Undocked Mode and non-zero otherwise. When this system metric changes, the system sends a broadcast message via WM_SETTINGCHANGE with "SystemDockMode" in the LPARAM.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_SYNC
member.summary: 同步播放声音，在播放完后PlaySound函数才返回。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_ASYNC
member.summary: 用异步方式播放声音，PlaySound函数在开始播放后立即返回。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_NODEFAULT
member.summary: 不播放缺省声音，若无此标志，则PlaySound在没找到声音时会播放缺省声音。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_MEMORY
member.summary: 播放载入到内存中的声音，此时pszSound是指向声音数据的指针。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_LOOP
member.summary: 重复播放声音，必须与SND_ASYNC标志一块使用。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_NOSTOP
member.summary: PlaySound不打断原来的声音播出并立即返回FALSE。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_PURGE
member.summary: 停止所有与调用任务有关的声音。若参数pszSound为NULL，就停止所有的声音，否则，停止pszSound指定的声音。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SND_FILENAME
member.summary: pszSound参数指定了WAVE文件名。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_LEFT
member.summary: 使文字在静态控件中左对齐。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_CENTER
member.summary: 使文字在静态控件中水平居中。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_RIGHT
member.summary: 使文字在静态控件中右对齐。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ICON
member.summary: 指定在静态控件中显示一个被定义在资源文件中的图标。该风格将忽略静态控件的高度和宽度，静态控件将根据位图的大小自动调节自身的尺寸。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_BLACKRECT
member.summary: 该控制域以填充的矩形显示，颜色与当前的窗口框架相同。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_GRAYRECT
member.summary: 该控制域以填充的矩形显示，颜色与当前的桌面相同。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_WHITERECT
member.summary: 建立一个白色的矩形。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_BLACKFRAME
member.summary: 该控制域以矩形边界显示，颜色与当前窗口框架相同。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_GRAYFRAME
member.summary: 该控制域以矩形边界显示，颜色与当前桌面相同。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_WHITEFRAME
member.summary: 建立一个白色的边框。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_USERITEM
member.summary: 建立一个用户自定义项目。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_SIMPLE
member.summary: 只显示一行文本，文本不能被剪切或替换(父窗口不能处理CTLCOLOR消息)。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_LEFTNOWORDWRAP
member.summary: 在缺省情况下，静态控件把’\n’和’\t’都作为换行标记。只有在设置本风格后，静态控件才把’\t’看作是制表键(缺省时制表键的宽度为8个字符的宽度)。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: 在指定该风格后，当静态控件在视觉外观发生变化时，该静态控件的属主窗口将响应WM_DRAWITEM消息。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_BITMAP
member.summary: 指定在静态控件中显示一个被定义在资源文件中的位图。该风格将忽略静态控件的高度和宽度，静态控件将根据位图的大小自动调节自身的尺寸。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ENHMETAFILE
member.summary: 指定在静态控件中显示一个增强型图元文件。该风格将不会忽略静态控件的高度和宽度，而图元文件将调节自身的大小来适应静态控件的尺寸。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ETCHEDHORZ
member.summary: 建立一个边框，并将顶端边框设置为浮雕风格。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ETCHEDVERT
member.summary: 建立一个边框，并将左侧边框设置为浮雕风格。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ETCHEDFRAME
member.summary: 建立一个浮雕边框。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_TYPEMASK
member.summary: 一种复合式的位，结果从使用OR运算符的SS_ *样式位。可以用来屏蔽掉从一个给定的位掩码有效的SS_ *位。请注意，这是过时和不正确地包含所有有效的样式。因此，你不应该使用这种风格。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_REALSIZECONTROL
member.summary: 调整位图以适应静态控件的大小。例如，更改区域设置可以更改系统字体，从而控制可能会被调整。如果一个静态控件有一个位图，位图将不再适应控件。这种风格位决定了位图的自动redimensioning，以满足他们的控制。如果SS_CENTERIMAGE指定，位图或图标居中（如果需要裁剪）。如果SS_CENTERIMAGE没有指定，位图或图标被拉伸或收缩。需要注意的是在两个轴redimensioning是独立的，并且结果可以具有改变的宽高比。与比较SS_REALSIZEIMAGE。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_NOPREFIX
member.summary: 防止在控件的文本作为加速器前缀字符任何解释的符号（＆）字符。这些都显示带有连字符去掉，字符串中的下一个字符加下划线。这个静态控件样式可能包含与任何定义的静态控件。您可以结合SS_NOPREFIX与其他样式。当文件名 ​​或其他字符串可能包含一个符号（＆）必须显示在一个静态控件在对话框中，这很有用。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_NOTIFY
member.summary: 发送父窗口STN_CLICKED，STN_DBLCLK，STN_DISABLE和STN_ENABLE通知码，当用户单击或双击控制。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_CENTERIMAGE
member.summary: 位图是集中在静态控件中包含它。该控件不能调整大小，这样的位图太大，控制将被裁剪。如果静态控件包含文本的单行线，文本在控件的客户区垂直居中。由于Windows XP中，这种风格有点不再导致被填充的位图或图标的左上角像素的颜色控制的未使用部分。对照的未使用的部分将保持的背景颜色。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_RIGHTJUST
member.summary: 静态控制与SS_BITMAP或SS_ICON风格的右下角是留在调整控件大小固定的。只有顶部和左右两侧进行调整，以适应新的位图或图标。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_REALSIZEIMAGE
member.summary: 指定实际资源的宽度使用和图标使用加载的LoadImage。SS_REALSIZEIMAGE总是配合使用SS_ICON。SS_REALSIZEIMAGE使用的LoadImage，通常覆盖在后面的过程中SS_ICON。它不会加载游标，如果的LoadImage失败，没有进一步尝试加载制成。它使用的实际资源的宽度。静态控制相应调整，但图标仍然对齐到原先指定的左侧和控件的顶部边缘。请注意，如果SS_CENTERIMAGE也指定，图标控件的空间，这是使用指定的范围内集中CreateWindow的参数nWidth和nHeight参数。与比较SS_REALSIZECONTROL。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_SUNKEN
member.summary: 周围绘制一个静态控件一个半下沉式边框。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_EDITCONTROL
member.summary: 静态控件复制多行编辑控件的文本显示特性。具体地，平均字符宽度的计算方法相同的方式，与编辑控件，并且该函数不显示部分可见的最后一行。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ENDELLIPSIS
member.summary: 如果一个字符串的结尾不适合在该矩形，将被截断和椭圆形被添加。如果一个字，它不是在字符串的末尾超出了矩形的极限，它被截断未经椭圆。使用这种风格将迫使该控件的文本要在没有自动换行一行。与比较SS_PATHELLIPSIS和SS_WORDELLIPSIS。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_PATHELLIPSIS
member.summary: 替换字符的字符串与椭圆的中间，这样的结果在指定的矩形适合。如果字符串中包含反斜杠（\）字符，SS_PATHELLIPSIS保留尽可能多的文本的最后一个反斜杠之后。使用这种风格将迫使该控件的文本要在没有自动换行一行。与比较SS_ENDELLIPSIS和SS_WORDELLIPSIS。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_WORDELLIPSIS
member.summary: 截断不适合在矩形和椭圆增添任何字。使用这种风格将迫使该控件的文本要在没有自动换行一行。与比较SS_ENDELLIPSIS和SS_PATHELLIPSIS。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SS_ELLIPSISMASK
member.summary: 无说明。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: Disabled

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_MIXED
member.summary: 3-state checkbox or toolbar button

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_FLOATING
member.summary: Children "owned" not "contained" by parent

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_MULTISELECTABLE
member.summary: Supports multiple selection

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_EXTSELECTABLE
member.summary: Supports extended selection

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_ALERT_LOW
member.summary: This information is of low priority

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_ALERT_MEDIUM
member.summary: This information is of medium priority

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_ALERT_HIGH
member.summary: This information is of high priority

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.STATE_SYSTEM_PROTECTED
member.summary: access to this is restricted

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_HIDE
member.summary: 隐藏窗口并激活其他窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: 激活并显示一个窗口。如果窗口被最小化或最大化，系统将其恢复到原来的尺寸和大小。应用程序在第一次显示窗口的时候应该指定此标志。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: 激活窗口并将其最小化。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: 最大化指定的窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: 激活窗口并将其最大化。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: 以窗口最近一次的大小和状态显示窗口。激活窗口仍然维持激活状态。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOW
member.summary: 在窗口原来的位置以原来的尺寸激活和显示窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: 最小化指定的窗口并且激活在Z序中的下一个顶层窗口。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: 窗口最小化，激活窗口仍然维持激活状态。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: 以窗口原来的状态显示窗口。激活窗口仍然维持激活状态。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: 激活并显示窗口。如果窗口最小化或最大化，则系统将窗口恢复到原来的尺寸和位置。在恢复最小化窗口时，应用程序应该指定这个标志。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: 依据在STARTUPINFO结构中指定的SW_FLAG标志设定显示状态，STARTUPINFO 结构是由启动应用程序的程序传递给CreateProcess函数的。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: 在WindowNT5.0中最小化窗口，即使拥有窗口的线程被挂起也会最小化。在从其他线程最小化窗口时才使用这个参数。

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTDT_AUTOMATIC
member.summary: Set all three delay times to default proportions. The autopop time will be ten times the initial time and the reshow time will be one fifth the initial time. If this flag is set, use a positive value of lParam to specify the initial time, in milliseconds. Set lParam to a negative value to return all three delay times to their default values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTDT_RESHOW
member.summary: Set the amount of time it takes for subsequent tooltip windows to appear as the pointer moves from one tool to another. To return the reshow delay time to its default value, set lParam to -1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTDT_AUTOPOP
member.summary: Set the amount of time a tooltip window remains visible if the pointer is stationary within a tool's bounding rectangle. To return the autopop delay time to its default value, set lParam to -1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTDT_INITIAL
member.summary: Set the amount of time a pointer must remain stationary within a tool's bounding rectangle before the tooltip window appears. To return the initial delay time to its default value, set lParam to -1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_IDISHWND
member.summary: Indicates that the uId member is the window handle to the tool. If this flag is not set, uId is the tool's identifier.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_CENTERTIP
member.summary: Centers the tooltip window below the tool specified by the uId member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_RTLREADING
member.summary: Indicates that the tooltip text will be displayed in the opposite direction to the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_SUBCLASS
member.summary: Indicates that the tooltip control should subclass the tool's window to intercept messages, such as WM_MOUSEMOVE. If this flag is not set, you must use the TTM_RELAYEVENT message to forward messages to the tooltip control. For a list of messages that a tooltip control processes, see TTM_RELAYEVENT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_TRACK
member.summary: Version 4.70 and later. Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds and moves the window according to coordinates supplied by the TTM_TRACKPOSITION messages. You must activate this type of tool using the TTM_TRACKACTIVATE message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_ABSOLUTE
member.summary: Version 4.70 and later. Positions the tooltip window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION. This flag must be used with the TTF_TRACK flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Version 4.70 and later. Causes the tooltip control to forward mouse event messages to the parent window. This is limited to mouse events that occur within the bounds of the tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_PARSELINKS
member.summary: Version 6.0 and later. Indicates that links in the tooltip text should be parsed.Note that Comctl32.dll version 6 is not redistributable but it is included in Windows XP or later. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in a manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTF_DI_SETITEM
member.summary: valid only on the TTN_NEEDTEXT callback

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_NONE
member.summary: Use no icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_INFO
member.summary: Use the information icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_WARNING
member.summary: Use the warning icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_ERROR
member.summary: Use the error icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_INFO_LARGE
member.summary: Use the large information icon. This is assumed to be an HICON value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_WARNING_LARGE
member.summary: Use the large warning icon. This is assumed to be an HICON value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTI_ERROR_LARGE
member.summary: Use the large error icon. This is assumed to be an HICON value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates or deactivates a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETDELAYTIME
member.summary: Sets the initial, pop-up, and reshow durations for a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_ADDTOOL
member.summary: Registers a tool with a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_DELTOOL
member.summary: Removes a tool from a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_NEWTOOLRECT
member.summary: Sets a new bounding rectangle for a tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_RELAYEVENT
member.summary: Passes a mouse message to a tooltip control for processing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTOOLINFO
member.summary: Retrieves the information that a tooltip control maintains about a tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETTOOLINFO
member.summary: Sets the information that a tooltip control maintains for a tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_HITTEST
member.summary: Tests a point to determine whether it is within the bounding rectangle of the specified tool and, if it is, retrieves information about the tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTEXT
member.summary: Retrieves the information a tooltip control maintains about a tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_UPDATETIPTEXT
member.summary: Sets the tooltip text for a tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTOOLCOUNT
member.summary: Retrieves a count of the tools maintained by a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_ENUMTOOLS
member.summary: Retrieves the information that a tooltip control maintains about the current tool—that is, the tool for which the tooltip is currently displaying text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETCURRENTTOOL
member.summary: Retrieves the information for the current tool in a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_WINDOWFROMPOINT
member.summary: Allows a subclass procedure to cause a tooltip to display text for a window other than the one beneath the mouse cursor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_TRACKACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates or deactivates a tracking tooltip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_TRACKPOSITION
member.summary: Sets the position of a tracking tooltip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETTIPBKCOLOR
member.summary: Sets the background color in a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETTIPTEXTCOLOR
member.summary: Sets the text color in a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETDELAYTIME
member.summary: Retrieves the initial, pop-up, and reshow durations currently set for a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTIPBKCOLOR
member.summary: Retrieves the background color in a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTIPTEXTCOLOR
member.summary: Retrieves the text color in a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETMAXTIPWIDTH
member.summary: Sets the maximum width for a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETMAXTIPWIDTH
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum width for a tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETMARGIN
member.summary: Sets the top, left, bottom, and right margins for a tooltip window. A margin is the distance, in pixels, between the tooltip window border and the text contained within the tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETMARGIN
member.summary: Retrieves the top, left, bottom, and right margins set for a tooltip window. A margin is the distance, in pixels, between the tooltip window border and the text contained within the tooltip window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_POP
member.summary: Removes a displayed tooltip window from view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_UPDATE
member.summary: Forces the current tooltip to be redrawn.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETBUBBLESIZE
member.summary: Returns the width and height of a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_ADJUSTRECT
member.summary: Calculates a tooltip control's text display rectangle from its window rectangle, or the tooltip window rectangle needed to display a specified text display rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETTITLE
member.summary: Adds a standard icon and title string to a tooltip.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_POPUP
member.summary: Causes the tooltip to display at the coordinates of the last mouse message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_GETTITLE
member.summary: Retrieve information concerning the title of a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTM_SETWINDOWTHEME
member.summary: Sets the visual style of a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_FIRST
member.summary: 开始

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_LAST
member.summary: 结束

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_SHOW
member.summary: Notifies the owner window that a tooltip control is about to be displayed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_POP
member.summary: Notifies the owner window that a tooltip is about to be hidden. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_LINKCLICK
member.summary: Sent when a text link inside a balloon tooltip is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_GETDISPINFO
member.summary: Sent by a tooltip control to retrieve information needed to display a tooltip window. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTN_NEEDTEXT
member.summary: Sent by a tooltip control to retrieve information needed to display a tooltip window. This notification code is identical to TTN_GETDISPINFO. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_ALWAYSTIP
member.summary: Indicates that the tooltip control appears when the cursor is on a tool, even if the tooltip control's owner window is inactive. Without this style, the tooltip appears only when the tool's owner window is active.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_NOPREFIX
member.summary: Prevents the system from stripping ampersand characters from a string or terminating a string at a tab character. Without this style, the system automatically strips ampersand characters and terminates a string at the first tab character. This allows an application to use the same string as both a menu item and as text in a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_NOANIMATE
member.summary: Version 5.80. Disables sliding tooltip animation on Windows 98 and Windows 2000 systems. This style is ignored on earlier systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_NOFADE
member.summary: Version 5.80. Disables fading tooltip animation on Windows 2000 systems. This style is ignored on earlier Windows NT systems, and on Windows 95 and Windows 98.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_BALLOON
member.summary: Version 5.80. Indicates that the tooltip control has the appearance of a cartoon "balloon," with rounded corners and a stem pointing to the item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_CLOSE
member.summary: Displays a Close button on the tooltip. Valid only when the tooltip has the TTS_BALLOON style and a title; see TTM_SETTITLE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.TTS_USEVISUALSTYLE
member.summary: Uses themed hyperlinks. The theme will define the styles for any links in the tooltip. This style always requires TTF_PARSELINKS to be set.
